title: Did Biden Propose a Ban on Fracking?
subtitle: The Trump campaign has hammered the Democratic candidate on fracking and fossil fuels. But what has Biden actually said?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the 2020 presidential election, Democratic candidate Joe Biden's policy on fracking was to ban it outright.

title: Does Biden Want To Abolish the Second Amendment?
subtitle: President Trump and his administration have asserted the claim on more than one occasion.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: If elected, U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden wants to abolish the Second Amendment, regarding the “right of the people to keep and bear Arms.”

title: Is This 'Biden Muslim Ad' Real?
subtitle: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden has appealed to several faith groups.
author: Dan Evon
statement: In summer 2020, U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's campaign released a so-called "Muslim ad" courting Muslim voters.

title: Is the White House Gift Shop Selling a 'Trump Defeats COVID-19' Coin?
subtitle: Question is whether the coin comes from an official government gift shop.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The White House gift shop is selling a "Trump Defeats COVID-19" commemorative coin.

title: Were 'Doomsday Planes' Mobilized After Trump's COVID-19 Diagnosis?
subtitle: Rumors took off when a scheduled launch of two "doomsday planes" seemed to coincide with the announcement of the president's diagnosis.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump's diagnosis with COVID-19 spurred the launch of "doomsday planes."

title: Did Obama Get Caught 'Spying' on Trump's 2016 Campaign?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump claimed his predecessor, or unidentified political opponents, "spied on our campaign illegally" numerous times.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Former U.S. President Barack Obama ordered counterintelligence agents to illegally "spy" on Donald Trump's campaign for president in 2016.

title: Did Biden Disparage Troops as 'Stupid Bastards'?
subtitle: An offhanded remark during a 2016 speech was "made in jest," according to the Biden campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden disparaged U.S. troops as "stupid bastards" during a 2016 speech.

title: Did Trump Inherit a 'Depleted' Stockpile of Ventilators From Obama?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump repeatedly tried to buck the blame for the “empty cupboards” of federal emergency medical supplies.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: When U.S. President Donald Trump took office, he inherited a “bare” Strategic National Stockpile that lacked an adequate supply of mechanical ventilators that would have aided the nation at the start of the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Amy Coney Barrett's Religious Group Inspire 'The Handmaid's Tale'?
subtitle: In the dystopian Margaret Atwood novel, a futuristic American society is ruled by a Christian fundamentalist government, and women are deprived of their rights, including reproductive rights.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Judge Amy Coney Barrett, U.S. President Donald Trump's Supreme Court nominee, is a member of a Christian group that inspired Margaret Atwood's dystopian novel “The Handmaid's Tale.”

title: Did Trump Inherit a 'Depleted' Military From Obama?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump has repeatedly exaggerated the "depleted" state of the military when he took office.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump inherited a "depleted" military from President Obama.

title: Did Tucker Carlson Say He Was 'On Board' With Democratic Socialism?
subtitle: The viral video clip appeared to cut off just as the Fox News host was building to a "but."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Fox News host Tucker Carlson saying that he was "basically on board" with the tenets of democratic socialism.

title: Is Facebook Banning Livestreamed Music Events?
subtitle: New Facebook terms of service will come into effect on Oct. 1, 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: As of Oct. 1, 2020, Facebook will ban livestreams and videos on their products that “create a music listening experience.”

title: Is BLM To Blame for the Shooting of 2 Deputies?
subtitle: Critics of the movement against racism in U.S. law enforcement were quick to connect dots that didn't exist.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: A gunman associated with the Black Lives Matter (BLM) movement shot and wounded two Los Angeles County sheriff's deputies on Sept. 12, 2020, and BLM protesters afterwards blocked emergency access to the hospital where the deputies received medical treatment.

title: Did Medal of Honor Recipient Joe Jackson Die Without Proper Tribute?
subtitle: Retired U.S. Air Force Colonel Joe Jackson, a Medal of Honor recipient, died at age 95 in January 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The death of retired U.S. Air Force Colonel Joe Jackson, a Medal of Honor recipient, went unmentioned in January 2019.

title: Did a Black Man Invent the Lightbulb, As Joe Biden Claimed?
subtitle: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden tried to make a point about Black history in the wake of police shootings.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A Black man invented the lightbulb, not “a white guy named Edison,” according to presidential candidate Joe Biden in September 2020.

title: Is This an Image of Trump and Manson Being Shared by Trump Supporters?
subtitle: A depiction - or two - of Jesus took on a political life in the summer of 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image of U.S. President Donald Trump and convicted killer Charles Manson was widely circulated by the president's supporters who mistook Manson for Jesus.

title: Is This a Real Lineup of Speakers at the Republican National Convention?
subtitle: Kid Rock, “MyPillow Guy,” and “MAGA hat kid” were just a few of the speakers rumored to be lined up for the 2020 GOP convention, according to a meme.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A meme accurately lists six of the speakers scheduled to appear at the Republican National Convention in August 2020.

title: Did Pepsi Donate $100M to Black Lives Matter?
subtitle: Not every project related to racial justice is automatically linked to the Black Lives Matter movement.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2020, PepsiCo gave $100 million to entities or projects associated with the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Will an Asteroid Hit Earth Right Before Election Day?
subtitle: Not all asteroids are created equal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An asteroid is expected to hit Earth on Nov. 2, 2020, right before Election Day in the U.S.

title: Did 41 Senators 'Vote to Let Babies Scream Until They Die If Born Alive'?
subtitle: U.S. Senate Bill 311 provoked widely shared social media posts that targeted Democratic and Independent senators in 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2019 and 2020, Democratic and Independent U.S. Senators voted to allow health care practitioners to let babies die, untreated, if born alive after an abortion.

title: Did Democrats Omit 'Under God' from the Pledge of Allegiance?
subtitle: The phrase "under God" is still regularly recited by members of the Democratic party.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Democratic National Convention omitted the phrase "under God" from the Pledge of Allegiance in 2020.

title: Is USPS Locking Mailboxes To Undermine 2020 Election?
subtitle: Mailbox rumors swirled in 2020, as did real concern about the U.S. Postal Service's ability to meet demand before the general election.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The U.S. Postal Service placed locks on mailboxes to prevent voters from casting mail-in ballots in the 2020 presidential election.

title: Did Trump Pay $35M to Settle Child Rape Claims Against Him?
subtitle: An "utterly deranged nutter with a mind unclouded by facts, evidence, or reason" may not be the best of sources.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump has been the target of multiple accusations that he raped children aged 13 and younger, and he paid at least $35 million to settle most of those claims.

title: Did Biden Call for an 'End to Shareholder Capitalism'?
subtitle: Fear-mongering Facebook memes misrepresented the position articulated by the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee in a speech in July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Former U.S. Vice President and presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden called for an end to shareholder capitalism in July 2020.

title: Does 'ABA' Letter Prove Anyone Making COVID-19 Masks Can Be Sued?
subtitle: A letter falsely attributed to the Ohio State Bar Association made some questionable claims.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A July 2020 letter purportedly sent by the Ohio State Bar Association (OSBA) was accurate in stating that any retailer or manufacturer - including those operating from homes - could be sued for selling or creating COVID-19 protective face masks that were not medically approved, defective, or without proper labeling.

title: Did Seattle Police Chief Tell Residents 'We Cannot Enforce the Law, You Are On Your Own'?
subtitle: In June 2020, Seattle City Council passed a law banning police from using "crowd control weapons."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a letter in July 2020, Seattle Police Chief Carmen Best told residents and business owners, "We cannot enforce the law. You are on your own," or words to that effect.

title: Did Twitter Ban the Display of the Star of David?
subtitle: Many Twitter users claimed in July 2020 that they were locked out of their accounts after posting images of the religious symbol.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Twitter has banned users from displaying the Star of David in their profile pictures.

title: Did Betsy DeVos Say Schools Can't Plan for a COVID-19 Outbreak That 'Hasn't Happened Yet'?
subtitle: The U.S. secretary of education's actual statement came during a CNN interview that went a bit in circles.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In response to a question in a July 2020 CNN interview about what would happen if a COVID-19 outbreak occurred in schools, U.S. Education Secretary Betsy DeVos said, “You can't plan for something that hasn't happened yet.”

title: Did 85 Babies Under Age 1 Test Positive for COVID-19 in Single Texas County?
subtitle: "These babies have not even had their first birthday yet," Nueces County Public Health Director Annette Rodriguez said.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of July 17, 2020, Nueces County in Texas had seen 85 positive COVID-19 tests among children aged under 1 year.

title: Were Florida Labs Busted for Not Reporting Negative COVID-19 Results?
subtitle: Percentage rates of positive results got confused at some labs, but one thing remained clear: COVID-19 cases were spiking in Florida in July 2020.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Thirty-three Florida labs were busted for "cooking the books" or tampering with data after not reporting negative COVID-19 test results between March and July 2020.

title: Did a Minnesota School Toss Library Books to 'Erase History'?
subtitle: Viral images showed school library books piled in a recycling dumpster.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A Minnesota middle school discarded numerous “outdated” books in an attempt to "erase history."

title: Did Biden Say Taxpayers Must Fund Health Care for 'Illegal Immigrants'?
subtitle: Another Biden quote was misrepresented by U.S. President Donald Trump and the internet.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said U.S. taxpayers have an obligation to fund health care for 11 million "illegal immigrants."

title: Did the Hudson River Flood the Lincoln Tunnel?
subtitle: "Pretty sure there's a movie about this and everybody dies," one observer said dryly.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Hudson River flooded the Lincoln Tunnel on July 14, 2020.

title: Are Michigan Lawmakers Considering a Bill To Microchip Residents?
subtitle: New technology tends to be scary for some, but new legislation about new technology? It's not for the faint of heart.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In June 2020, the Michigan House of Representatives passed legislation that would allow employers to microchip workers on a voluntary basis.

title: Did Biden Say 120 Million People Had Died from COVID-19?
subtitle: A gaffe took on new life in the hands of Republicans and right-wing media.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: On June 25, 2020, at a campaign event in Pennsylvania, Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden incorrectly said 120 million people had died of the COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Did Michelle Obama 'Complete' a Ph.D. in Law Since Leaving White House?
subtitle: She has been keeping busy after eight years as first lady.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Former first lady Michelle Obama completed coursework for a Ph.D. in law after U.S. President Barack Obama left office and her children left home.

title: Is This a Valid Face Mask Exemption Card?
subtitle: Exemption cards citing the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) encouraged people to defy face mask requirements during the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: The U.S. Department of Justice issued a card that exempts holders from wearing face masks on the grounds that it poses a health risk to them due to medical conditions they aren't required to disclose by authority of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).

title: Did a Phone Service Outage Enable COVID-19 Tracking Apps To Be Placed in Phones?
subtitle: A pandemic and a phone network disruption created fresh conspiracy theories.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A cellular service outage on June 15, 2020, enabled Apple and Google to covertly install COVID-19 tracking apps onto phones.

title: Are These Claims About the Effectiveness of Face Masks True?
subtitle: Widely shared posts from the summer of 2020, purportedly citing the CDC and U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, offered numerous claims but little evidence.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A Facebook post is correct in saying N95 masks, surgical masks, and cloth masks can be dangerous and/or ineffective in protecting against the spread of COVID-19 based on CDC and U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) guidelines.

title: Did Joe Biden Call Antifa 'Courageous' Americans?
subtitle: An old Biden quote praising protesters who stood up to white supremacists in Charlottesville was making the rounds in 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Joe Biden called antifa (anti-fascists) who clashed with white supremacists at a 2017 Charlottesville, Virginia, rally as "courageous Americans."

title: Were Pallets of Bricks Strategically Placed at US Protest Sites?
subtitle: Entangling everyone from Bill Gates to local police, social media users alleged a grand conspiracy unfolding in U.S. cities during 2020 George Floyd protests.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Government officials, law enforcement, billionaires, or antifa groups nefariously placed pallets of bricks at protest sites in U.S. cities to stoke violence during June 2020 demonstrations against police brutality.

title: Are Birds Eye and Green Giant Vegetables 'All from China'?
subtitle: A meme circulating on social media appeared to serve up some xenophobia.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Birds Eye and Green Giant brand vegetables are "all from China."

title: Did Calif. Announce It Will Pay Undocumented Residents COVID-19 Stimulus While Laying Off First Responders?
subtitle: A meme linked two separate events together to foment political controversy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: On the same day California announced it would provide some undocumented residents COVID-19 stimulus payments, it also announced it would lay off first responders because of a lack of funds.

title: Do Mail-In Ballots Increase Risk of Voter Fraud?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump repeatedly made the claim as states scrambled to establish new elections rules during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In U.S. elections, mail-in voting systems "substantially" increase the risk of voter fraud compared to in-person voting.

title: Did Giuliani Correctly Tweet That Wuhan Lab Got $3.7M from US in 2017?
subtitle: Giuliani tacitly echoed President Donald Trump's assertion that the COVID-19 coronavirus came from a lab in Wuhan.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Rudy Giuliani correctly tweeted that a research lab in Wuhan, China, got a $3.7 million grant from the U.S. in 2017 despite a ban on such funding.

title: Is the Sun On 'Lockdown,' Threatening Life on Earth?
subtitle: The concept was very on-brand during the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic in the spring of 2020.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: By spring 2020, the sun had entered a "lockdown" period where its solar activity decreased to the point that famine, earthquakes, and freezing weather threatened life on Earth.

title: Is Italy Calling for Bill Gates' Arrest?
subtitle: While an Italian politician truly did call for Bill Gates to be arrested, this position has not been endorsed by the Italian government.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The government of Italy is calling for the arrest of Bill Gates.

title: Did Melinda Gates Wear an Upside-Down Cross?
subtitle: Critics claimed the billionaire philanthropist purposefully donned the symbol in video interviews about the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Melinda Gates wore an upside-down cross in broadcast interviews in May 2020 to denounce Christianity.

title: Was Emily Jones Decapitated by a Somali Migrant?
subtitle: The tragic story of a 7-year-old's killing was spun into racist misinformation shared on neo-Nazi websites.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 7-year-old named Emily Jones was decapitated in England by a Somali migrant.

title: Can People Without Disabilities Use an ADA 'Mask Loophole' in Stores?
subtitle: For the record, Americans without disabilities are not protected by the federal Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
author: Dan Evon
statement: Americans without disabilities can legally use a federal ADA "loophole" to avoid wearing a mask in stores that require them.

title: Does Pelosi Want 'Guaranteed Minimum Incomes' for 'Illegal Aliens' in Next COVID-19 Stimulus?
subtitle: A right-wing provocateur made the claim in a May 2020 tweet as federal leaders negotiated what to include in their next COVID-19 economic relief package.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: On May 4, 2020, U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she wants the federal government's next economic relief bill during the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic to establish "guaranteed minimum incomes" for "illegal aliens."

title: Is It Dangerous to Wear a COVID-19 Protective Mask for Too Long?
subtitle: Prolonged usage of certain masks can cause some health concerns.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Prolonged use of COVID-19-related face masks cause health problems due to breathing in too much exhaled carbon dioxide.

title: Are Hallmark Cards Made In China?
subtitle: An old rumor resurfaced amid a rise in Sinophobia during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hallmark greeting cards are made in China.

title: Is the White House Gift Shop Selling Coronavirus Commemorative Coins?
subtitle: Sometimes names can be deceiving.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The White House Gift Shop is selling coronavirus commemorative coins.

title: Is This COVID-19 Mask Efficacy Chart Accurate?
subtitle: The CDC recommends wearing a cloth face mask in public during the COVID-19 pandemic to help slow the spread of the disease.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A chart accurately shows the effectiveness of wearing face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Pelosi Say Congress Would Not Return 'Unless There Is an Emergency'?
subtitle: Both the U. S. House and Senate extended their recesses until May 4 due to the dangers of coronavirus.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U. S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi declared during the COVID-19 pandemic that Congress would be out of session "unless there is an emergency."

title: Does Microsoft Own Patent '666' About Implanting Microchips in People?
subtitle: The Redmond, Wash.-based computer company published a patent for a "cryptocurrency system using body activity data."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Microsoft owns patent "666," which involves inserting microchips into people to mine their activity for cryptocurrency purposes.

title: Was March 2020 the First March Since 2002 Without a US School Shooting?
subtitle: The definition of a "school shooting" varies depending on whom you ask.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: March 2020 was the first March without a school shooting in the U.S. since 2002.

title: Does Trump Benefit Financially by Promoting Hydroxychloroquine as COVID-19 Treatment?
subtitle: The U.S. president is invested in several mutual funds - some of which include very minor stakes in pharmaceutical companies.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump will benefit financially if hydroxychloroquine becomes an established treatment for COVID-19.

title: Does 'Tiger King' Joe Exotic Have Coronavirus?
subtitle: The Netflix documentary subject was put in isolation after he supposedly came in contact with someone who tested positive for COVID-19.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Joseph Maldonado-Passage, better known as Joe Exotic of "Tiger King," has COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Was a Rare Malabar Civet Spotted During COVID-19 Lockdown?
subtitle: Shelter-in-place orders amid the coronavirus pandemic may have given wildlife ⁠- and our imaginations ⁠- a little extra room to roam.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A critically endangered Malabar civet was seen for the first time since the 1990s during a COVID-19 lockdown in India.

title: Does China Have a 'New' Outbreak of Hantavirus?
subtitle: Hantavirus has been known to exist for decades.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A new disease outbreak caused by the hantavirus has been detected in China.

title: Did a TV Station Report Biden-Sanders Primary Results Before the Election?
subtitle: A test graphic using dummy data was never meant to hit the airwaves.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A television station broadcast results from the 2020 Illinois presidential primary the day before the election occurred.

title: Is Amazon Suspending All Deliveries Except Medical Supplies?
subtitle: An unclear headline and a paywalled article led to some confusion about Amazon's announcement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Amazon announced that it was suspending all deliveries except for medical supplies during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did 174 Democrats Vote Against Barring TSA from Hiring Terrorists and Sexual Predators?
subtitle: The "Rights for Transportation Security Officers Act of 2020" seeks to ensure that all TSA employees have access to protections afforded under Title 5.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 174 Democrats voted against a "bipartisan act to stop convicted terrorists and sexual predators from becoming TSA Agents."

title: Did Henry Kissinger Say These Things About Donald Trump?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post falsely attributed several quotes to the former secretary of state.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Facebook post accurately reproduces Henry Kissinger's thoughts on Donald Trump's presidency.

title: Did Bernie Sanders 'Honeymoon' in Soviet Russia?
subtitle: A 1988 political trip attracted new attention in the lead-up to the 2020 election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders honeymooned in the Soviet Union during the height of the Cold War.

title: Was Coronavirus Predicted in a 1981 Dean Koontz Novel?
subtitle: A speculative anticipation of a possibility is very different than a 'prediction.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Author Dean Koontz predicted the 2020 new coronavirus outbreak in his 1981 novel "The Eyes of Darkness."

title: Was Charles Lieber Arrested for Selling the COVID-19 Coronavirus to China?
subtitle: The arrest of a Harvard professor fueled conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 coronavirus disease outbreak in 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Harvard professor Charles Lieber was arrested for concealing funding from a Chinese lab connected to the origin of the new coronavirus.

title: Did Obama 'Order the CIA to Train Islamic State'?
subtitle: Supporters of Donald Trump attacked his predecessor's counterterrorism record after the death of IS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in October 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. President Barack Obama ordered the CIA to train and/or arm Islamic State fighters.

title: Was IS Leader al-Baghdadi Released from US Prison in Obama Era?
subtitle: IS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was once held at a U.S. detention facility.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was released from a United States prison during the Obama administration.

title: Did Elizabeth Warren Say of Mollie Tibbetts' Slaying, 'We Need to Focus on Real Problems'?
subtitle: Critics of the Democratic presidential candidate, and supporters of President Trump's immigration policies, seized on remarks Warren made in August 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Elizabeth Warren trivialized the killing of Mollie Tibbetts (the suspect is an undocumented immigrant) by saying, "We need to focus on real problems" like immigrant family separation.

title: Does Google Define 'Parasite' as a 'Capitalist'?
subtitle: Google is a search engine that provides links and definitions from reputable dictionaries.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Google has defined the word "parasite" as a "capitalist."

title: Did Sons of Top Democrats Do Business in Ukraine As Part of Clinton-Linked Conspiracy?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists outdid themselves in October 2019 in response to the Ukraine scandal that threatened Donald Trump's presidency with impeachment.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The sons of several top Democrats worked for Ukraine-linked energy companies, as part of a conspiracy involving the Clinton Foundation.

title: Did Barnes and Noble Market a Parody of Trump's Presidency as a Children's Book?
subtitle: Some social media users reacted with outrage to the publication of "If You Give a Pig the White House" in October 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In October 2019, Barnes & Noble sold or marketed a satire of Donald Trump's presidency as a children's book, or placed it in the children's section of stores.

title: Did Democrats Vote to Give Immigrants Better Health-Record System Than Vets?
subtitle: Right-leaning websites and Republican politicians misrepresented the facts around a September 2019 debate in Congress.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2019, U.S. House Democrats voted for a bill that would create an electronic health record system for immigrants on the southern border which does not yet exist for military veterans.

title: Is Adam Schiff 'Linked' to a 'Prominent Ukrainian Arms Dealer'?
subtitle: A fundraiser held for Schiff in 2013 was offered as proof of "ties" to a California-based engineer ... who also isn't Ukrainian.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Rep. Adam Schiff is "linked" to a Ukrainian arms dealer.

title: Did Mainstream Media Outlets 'Refuse' to Cover Abortion Doctor Ulrich Klopfer?
subtitle: NBC News: "Thousands of fetal remains were found on property in Illinois owned by a recently deceased doctor who performed abortions."
author: Dan Evon
statement: ABC, CBS, NBC, MSNBC, NPR, PBS all refused to cover abortionist who kept 2,246 aborted babies.

title: Did Portland, Oregon, 'Ban Urinals in Public Buildings'?
subtitle: A right-leaning website grossly exaggerated a design choice made to accommodate gender-neutral bathrooms.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2019, city officials in Portland, Oregon, announced or implemented a prohibition on urinals in public buildings in the city.

title: Have Democrats Tried to Impeach Every GOP President Since Ike?
subtitle: The question arises in light of the U.S. House of Representatives' launching of an impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump in fall 2019.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Democratic party has tried to impeach every Republican president since Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: Do Photos Show Greta Thunberg with George Soros, ISIS, and the 'Antifa Terrorist Organization'?
subtitle: The teenage climate activist's high-profile speeches in Congress and the United Nations prompted attacks from online detractors.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Photographs shared widely in September 2019 showed Greta Thunberg posing with George Soros and a member of Isis and "aligning herself" with Antifa.

title: Did Fake 'Home Affairs' Officials Commit a Census-Linked Robbery Scam?
subtitle: Social media users in the U.S., U.K., and elsewhere shared a years-old scam with origins in a real criminal operation in South Africa.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral social media warning in September 2019 described an actual robbery scam by criminals posing as "Home Affairs" officials.

title: Does Chick-fil-A Pay a $17 Starting Wage?
subtitle: Company spokesperson: "Chick-fil-A restaurants are individually owned and operated, so wage decisions are made at the local level."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chick-fil-A offers a starting wage of $17.

title: Was the US Ranked the '118th Safest Country' in the World in 2019?
subtitle: A widely-shared tweet misrepresented and over-simplified the Global Peace Index, but it did allude to findings that would worry many Americans.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The U.S. was ranked the "118th safest country" in the world in 2019, a decline of 53 places since 2018.

title: Do Energy Drinks Show Up as Various Illicit Substances in Drug Tests?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post proved misleading and confusing rather than informative.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Red Bull and Bang energy drinks test positive for various illicit or prescription drugs in substance or urine tests

title: Did a 15-Year-Old Invent a '100% Accurate' Pancreatic Cancer Test?
subtitle: A prize-winning, high-school science project claiming to be a new diagnostic tool for cancer came with a lot of hype.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Jack Andraka, 15, came up with a “100 percent accurate” cancer-detection method that was “168 times faster, 26,000 times less expensive, and 400 times more sensitive” than current methods.

title: Will THC Be Removed From Drug-Test Screenings Starting on Aug. 30?
subtitle: Are you a medical-marijuana licensee in the state of Oklahoma?
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: THC will be removed from drug-test screenings “starting on August 30th.”

title: Did DOJ Say Christian Employers Should Be Allowed to Force Women to Wear Skirts?
subtitle: A left-leaning website took the U.S. Department of Justice to task for its intervention in a sex-discrimination case before the Supreme Court.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a brief before the U.S. Supreme Court in Harris Homes v. EEOC, the Department of Justice argued that employers should be allowed to force female employees to wear skirts, if the employer was Christian.

title: Did Donald Trump Call Himself the 'Second Coming of God,' the 'Chosen One' or the 'King of Israel'?
subtitle: Multiple internet memes and news reports played off comments the 45th president made in a series of statements in August 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: On Aug. 21, 2019, U.S. President Donald Trump articulated a belief that he is "the chosen one," the "King of Israel," or the "second coming of God."

title: Were Kellogg's Corn Flakes Created as an 'Anti-Masturbatory Morning Meal'?
subtitle: Numerous websites exaggerated the role of J.H. Kellogg's odd beliefs about sexual health in the creation of the breakfast cereal.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Kellogg's Corn Flakes were originally created in an effort to discourage American consumers from masturbating.

title: Are Ingredients in 'Impossible' and 'Beyond Meat' Burgers Indistinguishable from Dog Food?
subtitle: The burger-imitation products do share a few ingredients with some brands of vegan, grain-free “ultra-premium” dog food.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The ingredients of two popular plant-based burgers, Impossible Burgers and Beyond Meat burgers, are indistinguishable from dog food.

title: Does a Portion of Each Bang Energy Sale Go Toward Trump's Campaign?
subtitle: We know that the CEO of Bang Energy is a supporter of U.S. President Donald Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A portion of money from every Bang Energy purchase goes toward funding U.S. President Donald Trump's 2020 re-election efforts.

title: Is Rep. Omar's Father a 'Somalian War Criminal' Living 'Illegally' in U.S.?
subtitle: Online hoaxes about the congresswoman from Minnesota seem never-ending these days.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar's father is a "Somalian war criminal" living in the U.S. "illegally."

title: Are U.S. Reps. Ilhan Omar and AOC Polling at 8 Percent, 21 Percent Respectively?
subtitle: The figures cited by President Donald Trump supposedly were "leaked" to Axios by Democratic operatives, ironically.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Reps. Ilhan Omar and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez are polling at 8 percent and 21 percent respectively.

title: Matt Gaetz Mug Shot Memes
subtitle: The Florida congressman's mug shot is real, but memes that make use of the image provide false information.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A meme showing a mug shot of U.S. Rep. Matt Gaetz suggests that the congressman has had “seven DUIs” and is responsible for the “suspicious” death of his college roommate.

title: Are Migrants 'Free to Leave Detention Centers Any Time'?
subtitle: A widely-shared meme in July 2019 vastly overstated the freedom of movement available to migrants being held in U.S. immigration detention facilities.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of July 2019, migrants are "free to leave" U.S. immigration detention centers and return to their countries of origin, at will.

title: Did Megan Rapinoe 'Stomp' on an American Flag After the World Cup Final?
subtitle: Right-leaning commentators exploded into outrage after an incident in which the Stars and Stripes was briefly dropped to the ground amid joyous celebrations.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. soccer star Megan Rapinoe stomped on a U.S. flag as an unpatriotic gesture after the 2019 World Cup Final.

title: Does Facebook Have 'Shake-to-Report' Feature That Lands Users in 'Facebook Jail'?
subtitle: As of late May 2019, a new Facebook feature allowing users to report technical problems by shaking their phones was being rolled out gradually to all mobile accounts.
author: David Emery
statement: A new Facebook feature enabling users to report problems by shaking their phones has caused some users to be inadvertently reported for abuse and suspended.

title: Is This 'Your City on Socialism' Meme Accurate?
subtitle: A meme uses a series of miscaptioned and out-of-context images to make its supposed point about the effects of socialism.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A set of images document the impact of socialism on the lives of citizens.

title: Did Queen Elizabeth II 'Troll' President Trump with Her Tiara?
subtitle: How much shade can a tiara really provide?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Queen Elizabeth II wore a Burmese Ruby Tiara as a slight against U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Are These '16 Easy Tests' to Check Whether Food Is 'Fake or Real'?
subtitle: A viral video took off on Facebook in June 2019, but its claims about food safety were far from unadulterated.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The factual claims made in a Facebook video entitled "Is your food fake or real? Find out with these 16 easy tests at home!" are valid.

title: Is Target Donating $100K to 'Promote Gay Lifestyles to School Children'?
subtitle: The retail chain is donating to a charity that works to prevent the bullying of LGBT children in school.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Target is donating $100,000 to "promote gay lifestyles to school children."

title: Did Barack Obama Accept $21.6 Million in Foreign Contributions to His 2012 Re-Election Campaign?
subtitle: A number of right-leaning websites suggested that Obama "stole" the 2012 election by accepting illegal foreign campaign money.
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. President Obama accepted $21.6 million in illegal foreign donations to his 2012 re-election campaign.

title: Did a 'Mob of Somali Teens' Attack Minneapolis Commuters with Hammers in Racially Motivated Assault?
subtitle: A cluster of right-leaning websites jumped into action based on preliminary details about a May 2019 incident. But what actually happened?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A group of Somali teenagers used hammers to physically attack and injure several passersby at a train station in Minneapolis in May 2019.

title: Are Taco Bell's Cinnamon Twists Made by Deep-Frying Rotini Pasta?
subtitle: The online world seems a bit confused about the existence of various types of dough.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Taco Bell's cinnamon twists are made from deep-fried rotini pasta.

title: Does a 'New' School Textbook Describe President Trump as Mentally Ill and His Supporters Racist?
subtitle: There's a difference between voicing one's own opinion and describing the opinions of others.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A new high school textbook describes U.S. President Donald Trump as "mentally ill" and his supporters as racist.

title: Did NYC Ban Hot Dogs?
subtitle: Government-run facilities in New York City are definitely cutting back on processed meats.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New York City is set to ban hot dogs and processed meats in an effort to combat climate change.

title: Was a Google Doodle Created for Ramadan But Not for Easter?
subtitle: Google traditionally avoids making Doodles involving ANY overtly religious holiday.
author: Dan Evon
statement: There is an official Google Doodle commemorating Ramadan, but not one for the holiday of Easter.

title: Did Vandals Attack 12 Churches in France in One Week?
subtitle: A Breitbart report re-emerged on social media in the aftermath of the April 2019 fire at Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In early 2019, vandals targeted 12 churches in France over seven days.

title: Did Germany Request the Removal of U.S. Ambassador Richard Grenell?
subtitle: The controversial American ambassador in Berlin came under renewed criticism in March 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In March 2019, Germany requested the removal of Richard Grenell as U.S. Ambassador to Germany.

title: Did New Zealand Take Fox News or Sky News Off the Air in Response to Mosque Shooting Coverage?
subtitle: A television network prompted criticism for their decision to show edited footage recorded from the gunman's point of view.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The government of New Zealand pulled Sky News Australia off the air in March 2019.

title: Was a Trophy Hunter Eaten Alive by Lions after He Killed 3 Baboon Families?
subtitle: The death of a single poacher has been rehashed and embellished numerous times by disreputable websites.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A trophy hunter was eaten alive by lions in March 2019 after he killed three baboon families at the Ingwelala Private Nature Reserve.

title: Did U. S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi Announce a 'New Scheme to Take Down Donald Trump in 2020'?
subtitle: The supposed "scheme" entailed lowering the federal minimum voting age to 16.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Nancy Pelosi announced a "scheme" to "take down Donald Trump in 2020" by lowering the voting age.

title: Are the Obamas Tied to the Celebrity College-Admissions Scandal?
subtitle: Gordon Ernst was one of the coaches alleged to have accepted bribes from parents to provide entry into elite universities under the guise of recruiting. He also coached Michelle Obama.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Obama family was caught up in the March 2019 college admissions scandal.

title: Did Muslim Terrorists Bomb a Church in the Philippines “Yesterday,” Killing 30 Christians?
subtitle: Some social media users started recirculating stories about terrorist attacks perpetrated by Muslim extremists in response to a deadly mass shooting in New Zealand by a suspected white supremacist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The media ignored the deaths of 30 Christians who were killed in a church bombing perpetrated by Muslim terrorists in March 2019.

title: Does This Meme Demonstrate Racial Bias in Tax-Evasion Prosecutions?
subtitle: What do these four examples have in common?  Nothing of significance, as far as we can tell.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A comparison of four cases demonstrates a racial bias in tax-evasion prosecutions.

title: Were the Trumps Pictured With the Owner of a Massage Parlor Where Robert Kraft Was Arrested?
subtitle: Be skeptical of memes because they are often inaccurate.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trumps were pictured with the owner of a massage parlor where New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft was accused of soliciting prostitution.

title: Is Facebook Removing a Photograph of Rashida Tlaib Being Arrested?
subtitle: If you encounter something on a social network, then it hasn't been removed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of U.S. Rep. Rashida Tlaib being arrested is being removed from Facebook to protect her reputation.

title: Did California Pass a Law Protecting Pedophiles Who Rape Children?
subtitle: A bill signed into law by Gov. Gavin Newsom leaves the decision whether individuals convicted of particular sex crimes involving minors must register as sex offenders to the discretion of the court.
author: David Emery
statement: California Senate Bill 145, signed into law by Gov. Gavin Newsom in September 2020, shields pedophiles who rape children from having to register as sex offenders.

title: Was a Mars Rover's Final Message to NASA 'My Battery Is Low and It's Getting Dark?'
subtitle: A poetic interpretation of the Opportunity rover's final transmission from Mars went viral in February 2019.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Opportunity rover's final message to NASA from Mars was "My battery is low and it's getting dark."

title: Did the City of Denver Legalize Public Urination and Defecation?
subtitle: Joe the Plumber's web site distorted the facts around a set of criminal justice reforms introduced in Denver in 2017.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Denver City Council recently legalized public urination and defecation.

title: Did NFL Champion Tom Brady Attribute His Success to Gisele Bündchen's 'Witchcraft'?
subtitle: A conservative Christian radio host made hay with throwaway remarks made by the six-time Super Bowl champion in February 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Tom Brady attributed his success as an NFL quarterback to the "witchcraft" of his wife, Gisele Bündchen.

title: Did Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam Say He Would 'Execute a Baby After Birth'?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump used his 2019 State of the Union address to criticize the Democratic governor of Virginia.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam "stated he would execute a baby after birth."

title: Did Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Say it Was 'Wrong' for Billionaires to Exist?
subtitle: A conservative group fashioned a meme out of comments the Democratic Congresswoman made in January 2019. Was it fair and accurate?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said the existence of billionaires was wrong.

title: Did Most States That Legalized Marijuana Use Ban Marijuana Users from Owning Guns?
subtitle: A meme misrepresented the reasons why it is illegal for cannabis users to also be gun owners.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Most states that have legalized marijuana use have subsequently banned marijuana users from owning guns as a "back-door" gun control measure.

title: Can Federal Government Workers Be Fired After 30 Days of Shutdown?
subtitle: The law varies depending on the type of shutdown.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Federal government employees can be fired after 30 or more days of government shutdown.

title: Did Congress 'Set Aside' $50 Billion in 2006 for the Construction of Border Fencing?
subtitle: When some leading Democrats voted for the Secure Fence Act, were they agreeing to 10 times more funding than President Donald Trump requested for his border wall in 2018?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: By passing the Secure Fence Act in 2006, U.S. Congress members were voting to allocate or set aside $50 billion in funding for border fencing.

title: Can Eating Hot Cross Buns Trigger False Positive Breathalyzer Results?
subtitle: It should not be surprising that inaccurate results can be obtained when breathalyzers are used improperly.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The consumption of hot cross buns has the potential to affect breathalyzer readings.

title: Will Using the 'Wrong PIN' Protect You from Debit Card Fraud?
subtitle: A tip spread via social media advises that debit card theft via card readers can be easily thwarted
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Entering the wrong PIN into a card reader will protect you against debit card fraud.

title: Did 18 Migrant Children Die in Border Patrol Custody During the Obama Administration?
subtitle: The deaths of two undocumented immigrant children detained by Border Patrol agents in December 2018 prompted rumors that many more migrant children died on Obama's watch.
author: David Emery
statement: Eighteen undocumented immigrant children died in the custody of U.S. Border Patrol during the Obama administration.

title: Did a Trump Campaign Advisor Demand Sen. John McCain 'Answer Questions' - Four Months After His Death?
subtitle: As usual, the simplest explanation is the correct one.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In December 2018, Trump 2020 campaign advisor Katrina Pierson demanded that Sen. John McCain "answer questions" -- four months after his death.

title: Is California Imposing a 5-Cent Tax on Text Messages to Fund Free Phones for Immigrants?
subtitle: The purpose of a proposal by California state officials was quickly misrepresented in online posts.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: California plans to tax residents 5 cents per text message, with the money going toward free phones for undocumented immigrants.

title: Did Researchers Discover a 512-Year-Old Shark?
subtitle: Some headline writers latched onto the highest possible estimate from a 2016 study about the lifespan of Greenland sharks.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Researchers discovered a living Greenland shark that was 512 years old.

title: Bogus 'Now Hiring' Meme Still Circulating on Social Media
subtitle: If you're looking for seasonal employment, this perennial holiday meme isn't for you.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A meme offers job line phone numbers for several major companies who are currently hiring.

title: Did President Trump Fail to Place His Hand Over His Heart During George H.W. Bush's Funeral?
subtitle: Selective and misleading images of President Trump at George H.W. Bush's funeral went viral with critics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump failed to place his hand over his heart during George H.W. Bush's funeral.

title: Did President Donald Trump Overturn Farm Water Regulations, Causing an E. Coli Outbreak?
subtitle: A viral tweet misrepresented the nature (and consequences) of a bureaucratic decision made by the Food and Drug Administration in September 2017.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: An autumn 2018 outbreak of E. coli linked to romaine lettuce was caused by a decision by President Trump to reverse existing rules on agricultural water inspection.

title: Did Minneapolis Launch a 'Sharia' Hotline to Report Anyone Who Criticizes Islam?
subtitle: The "new" News Punch is just as fake as the old Your News Wire.  And just as unoriginal.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Minneapolis set up a "Sharia" telephone hotline inviting residents to report on those who criticize Islam.

title: Are 'One-Third' of Caravan Migrants Sick with HIV, Tuberculosis, and Chicken Pox?
subtitle: Many caravan migrants are dealing with assorted health complaints, but not these specific communicable diseases.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: One-third of the caravan migrants have HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, or chicken pox.

title: Did a College Mirror Nazis by Having Students Wear 'White Privilege' Pins?
subtitle: A widely-shared Facebook meme grossly misrepresented the nature of an infamous Holocaust-era policy and a month-long student campaign to stimulate debate around racial justice.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Democrats at Elizabethtown College mirrored the Nazi policy of forcing Jewish people to wear the Star of David in a February 2017 campaign that had students wear "white privilege" pins.

title: Is This a Genuine Photograph of President Trump Boarding Marine One?
subtitle: While President Trump's fitness has been the butt of a few late night jokes, a viral image of the Commander-in-Chief was slightly distorted.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Trump boarding Marine One.

title: Is Europe Governed by 'Childless Baby Boomers'?
subtitle: Confirmation bias includes cherry-picking information that confirms a particular point of view while ignoring contrary evidence.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Most leaders of European countries do not have children.

title: Did Donald Trump Predict Osama bin Laden Would Attack the US?
subtitle: President Trump mentioned Osama bin Laden in his 2000 book "The America We Deserve," but he didn't predict the terrorist leader would attack the United States.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump predicted that Osama bin Laden would attack the U.S. in his 2000 book, 'The America We Deserve.'

title: Did Obama Block Fox News Reporters from White House Press Conferences?
subtitle: Obama's relationship with Fox News was tempestuous to say the least, but none of the network's correspondents was ever banned or ejected from the briefing room.
author: David Emery
statement: The Obama administration blocked or banned Fox News reporters from White House press conferences.

title: Did an FBI Report Conclude That None of the Allegations Against Brett Kavanaugh Was True?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post significantly misrepresented what the FBI said about sexual assault and misconduct allegations against the Supreme Court justice.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A report issued by the FBI concluded that none of the sexual assault allegations against Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh was true.

title: Did Pipe-Bombing Suspect Cesar Sayoc Work at the Same Strip Club as Stormy Daniels, Proving a Hoax Conspiracy?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists got the details badly wrong in an attempt to link Sayoc with one of President Donald Trump's chief accusers.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Cesar Sayoc and Stormy Daniels worked at the same Florida strip club, suggesting or proving their parts in an anti-Trump conspiracy theory.

title: Does Carrying a Blue Halloween Bucket Signify That a Trick-or-Treater Has Autism?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post created the misleading impression that carrying blue pumpkin buckets on Halloween is a recognized signifier for autism.
author: Dan Evon
statement: All Trick-or-treaters carrying blue pumpkin buckets on Halloween have autism.

title: Is it Legal for a Migrant 'Fleeing Violence' to Enter the U.S. Without Authorization?
subtitle: A viral meme confused the legalities of entering the United States with the legalities of applying for asylum.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A 1951 United Nations convention gives migrants fleeing violence in their home countries the legal right to enter the United States.

title: Did President Trump Just Cancel Michelle Obama's School Lunch Program in 2018?
subtitle: The Trump administration rolled back a few guidelines of an Obama-era school lunch initiative, but the program wasn't cancelled, and those changes were made in May 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump cancelled Michelle Obama's school lunch program in October 2018.

title: Does Texas Law Prevent Women from Voting Due to ID Requirements?
subtitle: A years-old meme exaggerates the consequences of a controversial voter ID law.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Texas' photo ID law means voters whose photo ID name doesn't match their birth certificate name must bring marriage and divorce documents to the polls.

title: What Did Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Thomas Jefferson Say About the Constitution?
subtitle: An out-of-context, incomplete sentence and an apocryphal quotation do not make for an informative comparison.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme contrasts viewpoints on the U.S. Constitution expressed by Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Thomas Jefferson.

title: Do Facebook Donations Recur Every Month Even When a User Chooses a One-Time Contribution?
subtitle: The social network says they're working to fix a glitch that causes one-time donations to appear on bank statements as recurring even though they're only debited once.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Facebook users who donated to charities on a one-time basis were actually debited that amount every month for one year.

title: Were Brett Kavanaugh's Children Escorted from a Senate Hearing Room Because They Were Harassed by Hecklers?
subtitle: An Internet meme characterized the planned departure of the Supreme Court nominee's daughters from Senate chambers as a reaction to being heckled.
author: David Emery
statement: Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh's children were escorted from Senate chambers as a result of being harassed by hecklers during his confirmation hearing.

title: Did Ripon College Ban a 9/11 Memorial Because 'It May Offend Muslims'?
subtitle: A conservative youth organization's claims about Ripon College's response to a controversial poster were contradicted by school officials.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ripon College banned a campus group's display of a poster commemorating 9/11 because "it may offend Muslims."

title: Has Saudi Arabia Executed Activist Esra al-Ghamgam?
subtitle: A prosecutor has requested the death penalty for Shia activist Israa al-Ghomgham, but she has not yet been sentenced or executed.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Saudi authorities have condemned and executed female human rights activist Israa al-Ghomgham.

title: Has the Medical Term 'Vagina' Been Replaced with the Phrase 'Front Hole?'
subtitle: The term "front hole" was used in a safe sex guide designed to serve transgender people, but it has not replaced the word "vagina."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The medical term "vagina" has been replaced with the phrase "front hole."

title: Did Education Secretary Betsy DeVos Register Her Yacht in the Cayman Islands?
subtitle: Several viral memes made unfounded assumptions based on the complicated inner workings of the DeVos family's business interests.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Betsy DeVos owns a yacht called Seaquest, which she registered in the Cayman Islands to avoid U.S. taxes.

title: Did Ohio's 12th Congressional District Have 170 Fraudulent 'Voters' Over 116 Years Old?
subtitle: Right-wing web sites published misleading allegations of voter fraud in Ohio, based on very obviously flawed evidence.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ohio's 12th Congressional District recorded 170 fraudulent votes cast in August 2018 by persons with birthdates earlier than 1902.

title: Did President Trump Say If Soldiers Were 'Real Patriots,' They Wouldn't Take a Pay Raise?
subtitle: While speaking to U.S. troops about an upcoming military pay increase, Trump joked that he knew they didn't really want a raise because they're "very patriotic."
author: David Emery
statement: In a speech to U.S. military personnel, President Trump said if soldiers were real patriots, they wouldn't take a pay raise.

title: Did a Harvard Study Prove That “Unvaccinated Children Pose No Risk” to Other Kids?
subtitle: A deceptive and factually challenged blog post on an anti-vaccine website is not a “Harvard study,” yet its false conclusions are popular on social media.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A Harvard study proved that “unvaccinated children pose no risk” to other kids.

title: Did President Trump Share a Photo of a 'Bikers for Trump' Member with a Nazi Tattoo?
subtitle: President Trump may have greeted the 'Bikers for Trump' at one of his golf courses, but he didn't tweet a photograph of one of them bearing an 'SS' tattoo.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump shared an image of a "Bikers for Trump" member with Nazi tattoos, one of those who visited him at his golf club in Bedminister.

title: Did Major News Networks Ignore a Story About Korean War Remains Returning to the U.S.?
subtitle: A widely shared meme suggested that mainstream American news outlets largely ignored North Korea's return of the remains of U.S. soldiers killed during the 1950-53 war.
author: David Emery
statement: The major television networks MSNBC, NBC, CNN, CBS, and ABC provided little or no coverage of the July 2018 repatriation of the remains of 55 U.S. soldiers killed in the Korean War.

title: Did France Pass a Law Saying That 'Children Can Consent to Sex with Adults'?
subtitle: A disreputable web site distorted and misled readers on the subject of a new French law on sexual violence.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2018, French politicians passed a law which stated that a child is capable of consenting to having sex with an adult.

title: Has Iowa Seen an Alarming Increase in “Vanishing Children” This Summer?
subtitle: Statistics sound much scarier when presented without any context whatsoever.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The state of Iowa has seen an alarming increase in "vanishing" children reports in the summer of 2018.

title: Did Congress Vote to Take Away Food Stamps from 1.5 Million Veterans?
subtitle: A partisan Facebook page significantly exaggerated the likely consequences of the House's version of the 2018 "farm bill."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, the House of Representatives passed a bill that would deny all veterans access to food stamps.

title: Did HR 6054 Make It Illegal to Join 'Antifa'?
subtitle: The Unmasking Antifa Act, introduced to Congress in June 2018, would create additional penalties for committing "certain offenses" while in disguise.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The "Unmasking Antifa Act" has made it illegal to join "Antifa" groups.

title: Did a Business Owner Picket Sarah Huckabee Sanders' Family After They Left Her Restaurant?
subtitle: Mike Huckabee claimed in interviews that the owner of the Red Hen in Lexington, Virginia, organized an impromptu protest against his daughter's family.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Stephanie Wilkinson, owner of the Red Hen restaurant, followed the family of Sarah Huckabee Sanders and organized a picket against them at another restaurant.

title: Did Pope Francis 'Grant Immunity' to a Vatican Diplomat Caught With Child Pornography?
subtitle: A notorious fake news web site got the basic facts right about the crimes of Monsignor Carlo Alberto Capella but misrepresented the role of Pope Francis.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Pope Francis granted diplomatic immunity to a Vatican diplomat suspected of child pornography offenses in the United States.

title: Did 233 Representatives Vote to 'Steal' Social Security's $2.9 Trillion Surplus?
subtitle: Claims that lawmakers voted to spend a Social Security surplus to pay off government debt stem from an alarmist account of a failed balanced budget amendment.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: 233 U.S. Representatives voted in April 2018 to use funds from Social Security's $2.9 trillion surplus in an effort to balance the budget.

title: Did This Video Show Obama Agreeing with the Trump Administration on Immigration Policies?
subtitle: A video showing former United States President Barack Obama "agreeing" with President Donald Trump on immigration is deceptively edited.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows President Obama agreeing with President Trump on immigration policy.

title: Is Winnie the Pooh Actually a Girl?
subtitle: The character was written as a male bear - but it was originally inspired by a girl bear named Winnipeg.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The famous children's character "Winnie the Pooh" is a female bear.

title: Was Robert De Niro Involved in a Child Sex Trafficking Ring?
subtitle: The Hollywood actor's profane Tony Awards speech led to the recirculation of rumors that he was involved in a "prostitution ring that used children."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Robert De Niro linked to a "prostitution ring that used children."

title: Is McDonald's Replacing All Cashiers with Robots to Avoid a Minimum Wage Increase?
subtitle: A fake news site twisted information about self-serve kiosks into a false claim that McDonald's is replacing all their cashiers with "robots."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: McDonald's is planning to replace all the cashiers in their restaurants with robots by the end of 2020.

title: Was a Man Arrested for 'Barbecuing' Pedophiles to Death?
subtitle: An arrested Florida man professed an intent to kill child molesters, but he didn't kill, set fire to, or "barbecue" anyone.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Florida man was arrested after rounding up pedophiles and burning them alive on a barbecue.

title: Did Barack Obama Pardon More Than 330 Criminals During His Final Week in Office?
subtitle: A popular meme confused pardons with commutations and spread an erroneous rumor about the former president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama pardoned Chelsea Manning and 1,700 other criminals during his eight years in office, including more than 330 in his final week.

title: Did Philadelphia Eagles Players Kneel During the National Anthem in 2017?
subtitle: The White House claimed that an event with the Super Bowl champions was cancelled due to a disagreement over kneeling during the pre-game anthem, but no Eagles player knelt in protest during the regular season.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Players on the Philadelphia Eagles knelt in protest during the National Anthem throughout the 2017 regular NFL season.

title: Is It Now Against the Law in California to Shower and Do Laundry on the Same Day?
subtitle: New water conservation legislation does not penalize individual California residents for specific water use.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: It's now against the law in California to shower and do laundry on the same day.

title: Has Ivanka Trump's Line Been Rebranded as 'Adrienne Vittadini'?
subtitle: In June 2018, a year-old story about Ivanka Trump's line being rebranded circulated as new news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In June 2018, Ivanka Trump adopted the alias "Adrienne Vittadini" to market her fashion line to unwitting buyers.

title: Is State Farm Denying Insurance to Gun Owners?
subtitle: Both the company and an insurance expert refuted online anecdotes painting the company as hostile toward firearm owners.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: State Farm insurance will not offer insurance to gun owners or manufacturers.

title: Will Snapchat's 'Cosmo After Dark' Channel Show Pornography to Children?
subtitle: "Cosmo After Dark" will feature content about sex, but this Snapchat channel isn't porn and will only be available to viewers 18 and older.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Snapchat channel "Cosmo After Dark" features pornography and will be shown to children as young as 13.

title: Did the Boy Scouts of America Implement a New Policy Requiring Condoms to Be Available at Jamboree?
subtitle: The policy has been in place for years and is not connected to BSA's decision to include girls.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Boy Scouts implemented a new policy requiring condoms to be available at its quadrennial World Scout Jamboree, shortly after announcing that girls would be able to join the organization.

title: Did a Woman Become Pregnant from Eating Squid?
subtitle: Years of exaggerated headlines have turned a painful story about a woman accidentally eating a squid's sperm bag into a particularly disturbing rumor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman in South Korea was impregnated via mouth after eating a squid.

title: Did a Woman Say a Theme Park 'Fat-Shamed' Her Because She Couldn't Fit on a Ride?
subtitle: An advocate for body acceptance wrote an opinion piece detailing her experience at a Harry Potter ride, but she did not say she was "fat-shamed."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A woman claimed she was "fat shamed" by a Harry Potter-themed ride after getting kicked off.

title: Did a Sexuality Educator Say Parents Should Ask Babies' Permission for Diaper Changes?
subtitle: Deanne Carson's commentary about consent and sexuality education appeared to be misconstrued on social media and by the press.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sexuality educator Deanne Carson said parents should ask a baby's permission before changing their diaper.

title: Was a Washington, D.C. Daycare Center Raided for 'Pimping Children to Elite Pedophiles'?
subtitle: Another embellished report from a site with a penchant for spreading fake news about pedophiles.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Police raided a daycare center in Washington, D.C., on suspicion that it was "pimping children" to "high-society pedophiles."

title: Did Pope Francis Say Gun Owners 'Can't Call Themselves Christians Anymore'?
subtitle: A notorious fake news web site wrenches the Pope's remarks out of context to create yet another sensationalist, misleading story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In May 2018, Pope Francis said people who own guns were "hypocrites" and could no longer call themselves Christians.

title: Did Singer James Blunt Prevent World War III?
subtitle: An anecdote about the musician's time as a soldier in Kosovo has been distorted over the years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer James Blunt once refused to follow orders that could have triggered World War III while serving with the British Army in Kosovo.

title: Did Melania Trump Plagiarize a Pamphlet for the 'Be Best' Campaign?
subtitle: The White House quickly corrected a statement on its web site claiming that a document written by the Federal Trade Commission in 2014 had been co-authored by First Lady Melania Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump plagiarized a document from the Federal Trade Commission for her "Be Best" campaign.

title: Are Schools Removing Analog Clocks Because Students Can't Read Them?
subtitle: A news report about analog clocks and timed exams morphed into a Internet-wide bashing of "kids today."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Schools are removing analog clocks because students no longer know how to tell time.

title: Was the Obama Administration Unable to Arrange the Release of Three Hostages in North Korea?
subtitle: Two of the three men being held by North Korea in 2018 were not detained until Donald Trump's presidency.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Obama administration failed to secure the release of three men being detained by North Korea in 2018.

title: Are Two-Headed Sharks Terrorizing the Ocean?
subtitle: A number of outlets reported on the discovery of a two-headed shark fetus by sharing doctored images of fully-grown sharks with two heads.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Images show a number of mutant sharks with two heads.

title: Did the NRA Ban Guns at Their Own Leadership Forum?
subtitle: Some gun control advocates misrepresented security measures imposed by the Secret Service, not the NRA, at a May 2018 event.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The National Rifle Association banned attendees from carrying firearms into their "2018 Leadership Forum" in Dallas, Texas.

title: Did a Second Broward County Sheriff's Deputy Die After 'Exposing' the Parkland Shooting?
subtitle: Several conspiracy sites attempted to link the deaths of two Broward County sheriff's deputies, suggesting a mysterious connection to a school shooting.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A second Broward County sheriff's deputy died suspiciously after "exposing" the mass school shooting in Parkland, Florida.

title: Are California Parents Barred from Withdrawing Their Children from Sex Education?
subtitle: Some web sites inaccurately describe the provisions of California's Healthy Youth Act.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Parents in California are not allowed to pull their children out of sexual education classes.

title: Do U.S. Citizens Have the Right to Resist 'Unlawful Arrest'?
subtitle: It's probably best not to get your legal advice from social media.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: United States citizens have the right to resist unlawful arrest.

title: Was a Pedophile Who Raped a 5-Year-Old Found Dead in Prison with His 'Testicles Missing'?
subtitle: A man convicted of sex crimes against a child died in prison, but not in the grisly manner claimed by fake news purveyors.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A npedophile was found dead in his prison cell after his testicles were removed and his injuries went untreated.

title: Are Michigan Lawmakers Marking Immigrants' Licenses with Yellow Stars?
subtitle: Memes suggesting Michigan lawmakers wanted to place a yellow star on immigrants' licenses were conflated a withdrawn proposal.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Michigan lawmakers proposed a bill to mark immigrants' licenses with a yellow star.

title: Is the KKK Tax-Exempt as a Religious Organization?
subtitle: Unfortunately, some hate groups do currently enjoy tax-exempt status.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The racist Ku Klux Klan is tax-exempt by the Internal Revenue Service as a religious organization.

title: Is Tilapia a Boneless, Skinless 'Mutant' Fish That Is Unsafe to Eat?
subtitle: An evidence-free Internet meme says that tilapia, one of the most popular freshwater fish consumed in the United States, is "killing our families."
author: David Emery
statement: Tilapia is a boneless, skinless, "mutant" fish that is full of cancer-causing dioxins, is worse to eat than bacon or hamburger, and is killing our families.

title: Did the World Health Organization Declare Medical Marijuana Has No Health Risks?
subtitle: A December announcement by a WHO committee stated that one specific component of marijuana is safe and should not require regulation.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The World Health Organization has declared that medical marijuana has no health risks.

title: Was a Russian Woman 'Embalmed Alive' with a 'Formalin Drip'?
subtitle: A number of international news reports about a Russian woman who was "embalmed alive" sensationalized what appears to have been a tragic medical error.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Russian woman was embalmed alive due to the intravenous administration of formalin.

title: Can Facebook Users Receive $17,500 Each Over a 'Data Breach'?
subtitle: Facebook users everywhere are not entitled to collect cash in compensation over the Cambridge Analytica user data controversy.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook users are entitled to $17,500 each as compensation over a "data breach" involving Cambridge Analytica.

title: Did a Mother 'Blow the Head Off' a Pedophile Attempting to Rape Her Child?
subtitle: An account of a Georgia woman who fatally shot a burglar in her home was embellished with fabricated elements by a fake news purveyor.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A notorious pedophile was killed by a mother who blew his head off with a shotgun when he tried to rape her 12-year-old child.

title: Is the 'Condom Snorting Challenge' a Real Teen Trend?
subtitle: Despite the media's breathless coverage of this alleged social media "craze," most of the extant videos of teens snorting condoms are a year or more old.
author: David Emery
statement: The latest social media craze entails teens making videos of themselves snorting condoms into their nostrils and pulling them out through their mouths.

title: Did Sweden Ban Mandatory Vaccinations for Children in 2017?
subtitle: Spurious blogs and "alternative health" purveyors tried to misrepresent the country's already-voluntary vaccination program.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Swedish parliament rejected seven proposals in May 2017 establishing a mandatory vaccination program, enacting a ban on the practice.

title: Is Using 'Bug Spray' to Get High an Alarming New Trend?
subtitle: Media reports conflate a number of events, some of them speculative, to manufacture the existence of an emerging trend about the use of bug spray.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Health officials have seen a surge in the number of people using "bug spray" to get high.

title: Did Harley-Davidson Close a Wisconsin Factory to Move Production to Thailand Due to New Steel Tariffs?
subtitle: The iconic motorcycle manufacturing company announced they were opening a factory in Thailand nearly a year before President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on steel imports.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Harley-Davidson announced in March 2018 that they were closing a Wisconsin plant and moving all manufacturing to Thailand in response to President Donald Trump's just-announced steel tariffs.

title: Was a Pedophile Found Dead in His Prison Cell with His Penis Chopped Off?
subtitle: A man convicted of sex crimes against children died in prison, but not in the grisly manner claimed by fake news purveyors.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A pedophile who was part of a gang that drugged and raped babies was found dead in his prison cell with his penis chopped off.

title: Did President Trump Sign an Executive Order Giving Veterans Free Care at Any Hospital?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post exaggerated efforts to give military veterans affordable and accessible health care.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump signed an executive order in March 2018 that grants veterans free health care at any hospital.

title: Did Rhode Island's Governor Sign an Executive Order to Seize Guns?
subtitle: Web sites mischaracterized the governor's order instructing state police to disarm individuals demonstrably at risk for violence.
author: David Emery
statement: The governor of Rhode Island signed an executive order allowing the federal government to confiscate people's firearms.

title: Does Suave Shampoo Contain an Ingredient That Causes Hair Loss?
subtitle: Social media posts inaccurately claim that the formulation of Suave Professionals brand products causes hair loss.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Suave brand shampoos and conditioners contains thioglycolic acid and cause hair loss.

title: Did Pepsi 'Admit' Their Sodas Contain Cancer-Causing Ingredients?
subtitle: Viral stories rehash a legal tussle between Pepsi and the Center for Environmental Health, but they mischaracterize that battle's outcome.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Pepsi admitted that their soda contains cancer-causing ingredients.

title: Did a Candy Company Put Out an Edible Pod After the 'Tide Pod Challenge' Controversy?
subtitle: Mars, Incorporated makes a "Pods" product, but these candies were first manufactured more than a decade before the "Tide Pod Challenge" went viral in 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mars, Incorporated released a "Pods" product shortly after the Tide Pod Challenge went viral in 2018.

title: Did a Texas Teacher Named Heather Holland Die Because She Couldn't Afford Flu Medicine?
subtitle: The 38-year-old's death from complications of influenza became an internet cause célèbre after it was rumored that she couldn't afford lifesaving medication.
author: David Emery
statement: Heather Holland, a 38-year-old grade school teacher in Willow Park, Texas, died because she couldn't afford the co-pay for her flu medication.

title: Can Scraping Your Tongue with a Spoon Diagnose Health Conditions?
subtitle: A "screening test" highlighted on the 'Today' show and subsequently amended by a series of dubious websites is actually pretty useless.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Scraping your tongue with a spoon, placing that spoon in a bag, and putting that bag under a light for a period of time will provide useful diagnostic information about your health.

title: Can Common Household Plant Seeds Be Used As a Party Drug?
subtitle: The seeds of a number household plants can cause psychoactive effects, but they are far from a natural alternative to LSD, as popularly claimed.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The seeds of certain common household plants can be used as an alternative to LSD.

title: Did the Black Panthers Create the WIC Food Program?
subtitle: An Internet meme credited the Black Panther Party with inventing Women, Infants, and Children, a federal program that provides food assistance to impoverished mothers and children.
author: David Emery
statement: The Black Panther Party created the Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) program that provides supplemental food assistance to single mothers and their children.

title: Was Rihanna Banned From Senegal For Being Part of the 'Illuminati'?
subtitle: For once, a notorious purveyor of fake news gets some details right, but gets the overall story wrong.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Rihanna was barred from entering Senegal on the grounds that she was suspected of being part of the Illuminati.

title: Did a Democratic Congressman 'Storm Out' of Trump's State of the Union?
subtitle: Conservatives and conspiracy theorists have made much of the fact that Luis Gutiérrez quietly walked out three minutes before the end of Trump's speech.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Luis Gutiérrez left Donald Trump's 2018 State of the Union speech in anger or disgust at patriotic chanting.

title: Did Immigrants Dominate the U.S. Nobel Prize Tally in 2016 and 2017?
subtitle: Foreign-born, U.S.-based scientists and economists won a remarkable number of Nobel prizes in the last two years, but they didn't get them all.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Of the six U.S.-based Nobel science laureates in 2017, all were immigrants; every U.S.-based laureate in 2016 was also born outside the country.

title: Did Ronald Reagan Pave the Way for Fox News?
subtitle: A Facebook meme gets some facts right about the demise of the Fairness Doctrine but ignores important distinctions between broadcast and cable television.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ronald Reagan's Federal Communications Commission abolished the Fairness Doctrine, clearing the path for the emergence of Fox News.

title: Checking the Facts About 'Dreamers'
subtitle: An Internet meme cites extremely dubious statistics to convince readers that the young undocumented immigrants known as "Dreamers" are a detriment to society.
author: David Emery
statement: A social media meme cites accurate statistics to dispute the claim that so-called "Dreamers" have had a positive impact on American society.

title: What Happens When You Cross the United States Border Illegally?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post comparing U.S. immigration policy to that of North Korea and Afghanistan gets most of the facts wrong.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Undocumented immigrants in the United States receive a job, a driver's license, food stamps, health care, housing, education, a "tax-free business for seven years," and "child benefits."

title: Did the Media Ignore Obama Calling Libya a 'Shit Show'?
subtitle: President Obama used the term "shit show" in private to refer to the escalating violence in Libya following the death of Muammar Gaddafi.
author: Dan Evon
