statement: A shelter rented dogs for embarrassed adult Pokemon Go players and raked in tons of cash before all their dogs were swiftly adopted.

title: Did Saul Alinsky Dedicate 'Rules for Radicals' to Lucifer?
subtitle: Saul Alinsky made a literary allusion to Lucifer as 'the first radical known to man' in an epigraph to his book 'Rules for Radicals.'
author: David Emery
statement: Author Saul Alinsky dedicated his 1971 political tome "Rules for Radicals" to Lucifer.

title: Michelle Obama Copied Her 2008 DNC Speech from Saul Alinsky
subtitle: After Melania Trump was accused of plagiarizing Michelle Obama's 2008 DNC speech at the 2016 RNC, several sites claimed the FLOTUS herself has plagiarized Saul Alinsky.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Michelle Obama plagiarized Saul Alinsky in her 2008 Democratic National Convention speech.

title: Trump and Children Face $250 Million Tax Evasion Charges
subtitle: Donald Trump and two of his children are witnesses, not defendants, in a tax evasion lawsuit.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump and his children face charges of evading $250 million in taxes.

title: White House Lighting
subtitle: Inaccurate image claims the White House was illuminated purple the night Prince died but made no display for five police officers killed in Dallas.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The White House was illuminated purple the night Prince died but did nothing when five police officers were killed in Dallas.

title: Philando Castile Was Not 'Wanted for Armed Robbery'
subtitle: An article published shortly after Philando Castile was killed by police officers in Minnesota falsely reported that he was a suspect in an armed robbery case.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Philando Castile was wanted for armed robbery when he was killed by police officers.

title: UN Official John Ashe Killed the Day Before He Was to Testify Against Hillary Clinton
subtitle: Former U.N. Diplomat John Ashe did die in a June 2016 accident, but his trial was not set to begin five days later, and he wasn't testifying against Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ex-UN Official John Ashe died suspiciously the day before he was scheduled to testify against Hillary Clinton.

title: Three Syrian Refugees Assault 5-Year-Old Girl at Knifepoint?
subtitle: An event involving children that occurred in Twin Falls, Idaho, was widely reported in inaccurate fashion.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Three Syrian refugees raped and murdered a 5-year-old girl at knifepoint in Idaho.

title: Fresno and Tulare Serial Killer Warning
subtitle: Police say that viral warnings about a serial killer in Fresno and Tulare counties are not credible.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Five women (two of whom were murdered) went missing in California's Fresno and Tulare counties, but police are suppressing news of the incidents.

title: Orlando Shooter's Father Visited Hillary Clinton
subtitle: An unreliable web site reported that Seddique Mateen visited Hillary Clinton at her State Department office.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts the Orlando shooter's father, Seddique Mateen, visiting Hillary Clinton at the State Department.

title: Did London's Mayor Ban Sexy Images Because They're Offensive to Islam?
subtitle: London's Mayor Sadiq Khan sought removal of "body shaming" images from advertisements on public transit, but not because of Islam.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: London's Muslim Mayor Sadiq Khan banned images of "sexy" women because they're offensive to Islam.

title: Did a British Waterpark Ban Bikinis Because Muslims Were Offended?
subtitle: An old article about Muslim events at a British waterpark mysteriously resurfaced after the Orlando nightclub shooting.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: British waterpark Waterworld has demanded parkgoers dress in an "Islamically appropriate" fashion because Muslim visitors were offended by bikinis.

title: 'Terrifying Warning' About Ice Cream Trucks and Chloroform
subtitle: A viral social media post claimed that young girls were being drugged with chloroform by ice cream trucks, but the rumor appeared to be baseless.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mothers of girls should be on the lookout for ice cream trucks (specifically Mr. Softee branded ones) as reports of chloroform kidnappings have surfaced.

title: FEMA Earthquake Drill Disrupting California Primary
subtitle: A FEMA drill scheduled in the Pacific Northwest on 7 June 2016 won't affect the state of California at all.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Federal Emergency Management Agency scheduled a massive earthquake preparedness drill on the same day as the California primary.

title: Spy Cameras in Hotel Room Coat Hooks?
subtitle: A clickbait Facebook post claimed that cameras in hotel hooks were a risk to guests, but it cited a warning issued by police in Key West that was unrelated to hotels.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Spy cameras are commonly hidden in hotel room hooks.

title: Lithium Mine vs. Oil Sands Extraction
subtitle: An image purportedly showing the environmental differences between a lithium mine and an oil sands extraction facility is misleading.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows the difference between a lithium mine and an oil sands installation.

title: All Disney Movies Available on Netflix in September 2016
subtitle: Netflix has signed a deal making them the exclusive U.S. pay TV home outlet for new Disney movies, but they won't be offering the entire Disney film archive.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The entire Disney movie collection will be available for viewing through Netflix starting in September 2016.

title: Washington State to Teach Transgenderism to Kindergartners
subtitle: Reports of revised curriculum standards for Washington state  led to false rumors claiming that schools there will be teaching "transgenderism" to Kindergarteners.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Washington state has updated their curriculum standards to include teaching "transgenderism" to Kindergarteners.

title: Obama Forces Americans to 'Celebrate' Gay Sex
subtitle: President Obama officially proclaimed June 2016 to be "Pride Month," but he didn't demand that "all Americans ... celebrate gay sex."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama has demanded all Americans "celebrate gay sex" for the month of June 2016.

title: Are 'Black Diamond' Disney VHS Tapes Worth Thousands of Dollars?
subtitle: Multiple blogs have claimed that "Black Diamond Collection" Disney films on VHS are worth thousands of dollars, but the tapes are not rare nor selling for nearly that much.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: "Black Diamond Collection" Disney films on VHS are worth thousands of dollars, particularly "Beauty and the Beast."

title: Photograph Shows 100,000 Bikers at Rally with Donald Trump
subtitle: A years-old photograph was used to illustrate claims that thousands of bikers attended a rally with Donald Trump in 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts 100,000 bikers in Washington, D.C. at a rally with Donald Trump.

title: Bernie Sanders' Lavish Private Jet Menu?
subtitle: A menu from a Bernie Sanders charter flight is real, but the selections are standard fare for Delta charters and not an example of hypocritical excess.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders flew on a private jet and served a lavish menu when traveling to Rome in April 2016.

title: Hillary Clinton Disqualified by U.S. Code Title 18, Section 2071
subtitle: A chain message claims that Hillary Clinton is disqualified from holding public office under U.S. Code Title 18, Section 2071, but the application of that law to her is doubtful.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton is disqualified from holding the office of President under the provisions of U.S. Code Title 18, Section 2071.

title: Did Donald Trump Take $150K from the 9/11 Small Business Fund?
subtitle: A 2006 New York Daily News article about Donald Trump's receipt of $150,000 in federal aid post-9/11 was inaccurately revisited in 2016.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Donald Trump improperly received $150,000 in federal aid earmarked for small businesses damaged by the 9/11 attacks, despite the fact his business was neither small nor damaged in the attacks.

title: Nancy Pelosi Endorsed Bernie Sanders?
subtitle: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has not endorsed Bernie Sanders for president, but neither has she endorsed Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi has endorsed Bernie Sanders for president.

title: President Obama Bans the Words 'Negro' and 'Oriental'
subtitle: President Obama signed legislation pertaining to the use of dated terminology ("negro" and "oriental") in federal law, but he didn't make the words illegal.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama made the words "negro" and "oriental" illegal.

title: Barbara Boxer Gave Bernie Sanders Supporters the Finger?
subtitle: A grainy photograph doesn't show Barbara Boxer giving Bernie Sanders supporters the finger, and it hasn't been "scrubbed" from social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sen. Barbara Boxer flipped off supporters of Bernie Sanders off before claiming she "feared for her life" and exiting the stage at a Nevada convention, and a photo of the event has been censored by social media.

title: Police Warn Using 'Facebook Reactions' Is Dangerous
subtitle: Belgian police issued commentary about "Facebook reactions," but their remarks fell short of a warning and didn't involve danger to users.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police warned that using "Facebook Reactions" is dangerous.

title: Al Franken Said His Judgment is More Important than Constituents'?
subtitle: Senator Al Franken affirmed that his superdelegate vote would break from Minnesota's caucus results, but he didn't specifically suggest his judgment was "more important" than what his constituents wanted.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Senator Al Franken told a CNN interviewer that his judgment as a superdelegate was more important than that of his constituency.

title: Does Breyers Ice Cream Not Melt?
subtitle: A video that purportedly shows how a popular brand of ice cream doesn't melt is misleading.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Breyers ice cream doesn't melt.

title: Man Choked Girl in Bathroom Claiming Transgender Access Rights
subtitle: A man was arrested for allegedly choking a young girl in a bathroom, but the incident was unrelated to transgender restroom policies.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man claiming to be transgender allegedly assaulted a young girl in a Chicago restroom.

title: Dryer Sheets Full of Toxic Chemicals?
subtitle: Multiple "natural wellness" blogs claimed that dryer sheets posed health risks.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dryer sheets permeated with fabric softener contain at least seven dangerous toxic chemicals.

title: London's New Mayor Threatens Trump
subtitle: A statement by London's new mayor was framed to suggest that he threatened attacks against the U.S. if Donald Trump's anti-Muslim policies were implemented.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: London's new mayor Sadiq Khan threatened Donald Trump with terror attacks if the candidate's proposed anti-Islam proposals were implemented.

title: Bill O'Reilly Loses Custody Battle Due to Domestic Violence?
subtitle: A misleading February 2016 article was randomly republished in May 2016 to suggest Bill O'Reilly "lost" custody of his children due to incidents of domestic violence.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bill O'Reilly was denied custody of his children because he physically attacked their mother.

title: Apple Music is Deleting Files from Personal Computers
subtitle: A blog post entitled "Apple Stole My Music. No, Seriously" led many to believe that Apple was purposefully deleting files from personal computers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Apple Music is purporsefully deleting files from personal computers.

title: Have You Ever Been in an Accident Resulting in Your Death?
subtitle: No, an Obamacare questionnaire didn't ask respondents if they'd ever been in an accident resulting in their deaths.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Obamacare questionnaire asked respondents whether they'd ever been in an accident resulting in their own deaths.

title: Wax on Apples Causes Cancer?
subtitle: Wax on apples is not a little-known secret uncovered by a YouTube user, and the substance used is safe to eat.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Waxed apples cause cancer.

title: Obama Freed USS Cole Terrorist?
subtitle: President Obama didn't free a terrorist behind the October 2000 USS Cole bombing.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama freed USS Cole bomber Mashur Abdallah Ahmed al Sabri from Guantánamo Bay.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Free a Child Rapist?
subtitle: Hillary Clinton's role in a 40-year-old rape case became the focal point of a viral meme in 2016, but the claims made about it were mostly inaccurate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton successfully defended an accused child rapist and later laughed about the case.

title: Did an Oklahoma Court Rule It's Not Rape If the Victim Is Intoxicated?
subtitle: A controversial Oklahoma court ruling was widely interpreted to mean that under state law, rape charges could not be brought if the victim was intoxicated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Oklahoma court ruled that forced sexual contact cannot be considered rape if the victim is intoxicated or unconscious.

title: Koch Brothers Officially Endorse Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: After an interview, rumors flew that the conservative Koch brothers were endorsing Democrat Clinton for President over any of her Republican rivals.
author: Stephanie Larsen
statement: The Koch brothers have endorsed Hillary Clinton for President over any of her Republican rivals.

title: Indiana Primary Rigged for Clinton and Trump
subtitle: Tests run by Indiana news outlet WNDU before the 3 May 2016 Indiana primary were not evidence of rigged elections.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Indiana-based WNDU accidentally revealed that Indiana's primary was rigged for Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump by prematurely releasing election results.

title: Planet Fitness Locker Room Controversy
subtitle: Ongoing debate over transgender bathroom policies led to the revival of an old Planet Fitness locker room dispute.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Planet Fitness issued a policy in April 2016 allowing men to use women's locker rooms and women to use men's locker rooms.

title: Man Takes Photographs in Women's Bathroom Because of New Laws?
subtitle: A Pennsylvania man was arrested for alleged invasion of a women's bathroom, but he was not transgender or legally allowed to film there.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Due to new laws and policies allowing transgender people to use the bathroom that matches their gender identity, a Pennsylvania man snuck into a women's restroom and took photographs of a young girl.

title: Costco Lying About Cage-Free Eggs?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post claimed Costco lied about the sale of cage-free eggs, but the retailer openly disclosed their stances on ethical sourcing and cage-free numbers.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Costco lied about carrying cage-free eggs in their stores.

title: Voter Suppression in New York?
subtitle: New York voters won't be turned away from primary polling places for wearing shirts endorsing any particular candidate, and polling hours have not been cut to prevent people from casting ballots before work.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: New York voters will be turned away from the polls if they wear shirts endorsing specific candidates, and polling hours have been deliberately shortened to suppress primary votes.

title: Do Studies Show That Women with Big Butts are Smarter and Healthier?
subtitle: An Oxford University study that supposedly indicated "big butts make you smarter" was heavily distorted in news reports.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new study published by Oxford University researchers proved that women with big butts are smarter and healthier.

title: CAIR Wants to Change Memorial Day to Honor Terrorists?
subtitle: CAIR didn't call to end Memorial Day or to replace it with a holiday honoring "Muslim terrorists."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Council for American-Islamic Relations (CAIR) wants to cancel Memorial Day and replace it with a holiday honoring "Muslim terrorists."

title: Man Claiming to Be Transgender Arrested for Filming Women in Restroom
subtitle: A 2013 news story about a man filming in women's bathrooms was misrepresented as having occurred "last weekend" in 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A California man was arrested in April 2016 for dressing in women's clothes and surreptitiously filming women in a public bathroom.

title: Did Ted Cruz Oppose Self-Pleasuring Activities and Devices?
subtitle: Several online items have misleadingly claimed that Ted Cruz tried to ban dildoes in Texas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ted Cruz tried to ban dildoes while serving as solicitor general of Texas.

title: Is Chick-fil-A Offering a Free Meal Promotion for Mothers?
subtitle: A social media rumor held that new mothers or pregnant women were eligible for a free meal from Chick-fil-A, but we could only trace the promotion to one restaurant in Texas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: New or expectant moms can receive a generous free meal from their local Chick-fil-A.

title: Mississippi Bill Grants Churches 'Lethal Force' Powers
subtitle: A controversial Mississippi bill expressly allowed guns in churches, but it didn't legally bestow the power to kill at will on congregations.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mississippi has passed a bill granting churchgoers the right to shoot and kill citizens at will.

title: Temple of Baal in New York City
subtitle: Temporary reproductions of the Temple of Baal's arch (destroyed by ISIS in Syria) planned for New York City and London sparked inaccurate online rumors; the former was put on hold indefinitely.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Temple of Baal is being rebuilt in New York and London as an operable house of worship, with more such temples to follow.

title: Are Refugees Overwhelmingly Young and Male?
subtitle: Images claiming that waves of migrants and refugees asking for asylum are "mostly young men" are based on faulty or misleading statistics.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Most refugees are young adult males.

title: Chobani CEO Importing 300 Muslim Refugees per Month
subtitle: A misleading image macro claimed Chobani's CEO vowed to "drown the United States in Muslims" and was "importing them to Idaho 300 at a time to work in his factory."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Chobani CEO Hamdi Ulukaya vowed to "drown the United States in Muslims" and is "importing them to Idaho 300 at a time to work in his factory."

title: Sanders Campaign Busing Youths to Caucuses and Primaries
subtitle: Social media rumors claimed Bernie Sanders bused youthful disruptors to rallies, caucuses, and primaries in order to crowd out  rival "legitimate" voters and participants.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders's campaign bused fake supporters to rallies, caucuses, and events in order to prevent legitimate attendees from being able to participate.

title: Emory Students Traumatized by Trump Graffiti?
subtitle: A controversy at Emory University over graffiti promoting Donald Trump led to some predictably inaccurate media reports.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Students at Emory University were offered "emergency counseling" after pro-Trump graffiti appeared overnight in campus "safe spaces."

title: Is Bernie Sanders Not on the New Jersey Ballot?
subtitle: Bernie Sanders wasn't on the New Jersey ballot in March 2016, but neither was anyone else.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders isn't on the New Jersey primary ballot.

title: Hillary Clinton: 'We Didn't Lose a Single Person' in Libya
subtitle: Hillary Clinton's assertion that "we didn't lose a single person in Libya" appeared to overlook victims of the Benghazi attacks, but it was taken out of context.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton overlooked Benghazi victims when she said that "we didn't lose a single person in Libya" during a campaign event on MSNBC.

title: Government Buries Weather Modification News?
subtitle: The government didn't quietly admit to modifying weather in California; cloud seeding is a well-documented effort to counteract the effects of drought (and isn't related to chemtrails).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The government buried news of weather modification in the classifieds section of a small newspaper.

title: Viral Video: Pouring Molten Copper Over a Big Mac
subtitle: A viral video showing molten copper being poured over a Big Mac does not demonstrate the "indestructible" properties of McDonald's food.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A viral video showing molten copper being poured over a Big Mac definitively proves that McDonald's food is indestructible and indigestible.

title: Donald Trump Supporters Seen Wearing Nazi-Style Armbands
subtitle: Yes, two men were photographed wearing Nazi-style armbands in conjunction with  a Donald Trump political event, but they were well-known political pranksters.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump supporters were photographed wearing Nazi-style armbands.

title: Code for Pedophiles on Toys?
subtitle: Parents on social media were warned about pedophiles' symbols after a little-known heart design appeared on a popular local event souvenir.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Parents should be aware that a code for pedophiles inexplicably showed up on a children's toy at motorsport event Monster Jam.

title: Did Barack Obama Skip Nancy Reagan's Funeral to 'Party'?
subtitle: President Obama was previously engaged to present a keynote speech at the South by Southwest conference before the death of Nancy Reagan, and sitting Presidents rarely attend the funerals of former first ladies.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama opted to skip Nancy Reagan's funeral in order to "party" at an "entertainment festival."

title: Donald Trump Nazi Salute Controversy
subtitle: Donald Trump asked rally attendees to pledge their support to him, and photos of the event compared the scene to Nazi Germany.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump encouraged supporters to engage in a Nazi-style salute at a campaign rally.

title: Bowdoin Mini Sombrero Controversy
subtitle: A cultural sensitivity controversy at Bowdoin College was misconstrued to suggest that mini sombreros offended oversensitive students.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Students at Bowdoin College in Maine were offered counseling because a party involved mini sombreros.

title: Did Germany Ban Pork Under Sharia Law?
subtitle: Germany hasn't eliminated pork or sausages from school canteens to appease Muslims.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Germany has banned pork from school canteens because it offends Muslim 'migrants.'

title: Cell Phone Guns
subtitle: The prototype for a gun that looks like a smartphone is real, but it isn't something designed by criminals to fool police.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Criminals have devised a new cell phone-like gun to fool police officers.

title: Cellular Companies Charging for Emojis?
subtitle: Viral warnings about unexpected emoji charges on cell phone bills were based largely on outdated or partially correct information.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Cell phone companies began charging users for SMS emojis (emoticons) in February 2016.

title: Concerns of 'Major' West Coast Earthquake Growing Due to Carbon Monoxide Spike?
subtitle: A fear mongering article attempted to link an alleged "carbon monoxide spike" with an earthquake prediction.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Carbon Monoxide spike on the west coast indicates that a massive earthquake will soon hit.

title: Microwave Ear of Corn Popcorn?
subtitle: A short-form kitchen hack video led many to believe it's possible to make popcorn by microwaving an ear of corn, but it has to be the right kind.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can microwave an ear of corn to make popcorn.

title: No, These Photos Don't All Show the Effects of the Fukushima Disaster on Marine Life
subtitle: Photos that claim to show the effects of the Fukushima nuclear disaster on marine life are actually cribbed from various unrelated corners of the internet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of widely-shared photos show the effects that the Fukushima Nuclear DIsaster had on marine life.

title: Obama Administration Fighting to Allow Non-Citizens to Vote?
subtitle: A Facebook video post featuring Lou Dobbs misleadingly claimed that the Obama administration is fighting in court to allow non-citizens to vote.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Obama Administration is "fighting in court" to allow non-citizens to vote in general elections.

title: Donald Trump iPhone Boycott Tweet Controversy
subtitle: Donald Trump did call for a boycott of Apple products, but the tweet didn't come from his iPhone.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump called for a boycott of all Apple products in a tweet sent from his iPhone.

title: Did President Obama Snub Justice Anton Scalia's Funeral to Play Golf?
subtitle: President Obama's decision not to attend the funeral of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia wasn't based on his deciding to play golf instead.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama snubbed the funeral of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia in order to play golf.

title: Does Wine Before Bed 'Make You Skinny'?
subtitle: No, a Harvard study didn't just prove sinking wine before bed "makes you skinny" or that it aids weight loss.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Drinking wine before bed "officially makes you skinny."

title: Wood in Cheese?
subtitle: Multiple articles claimed that several widely available cheeses were "bulked up" with wood filler, a highly misleading assertion.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Several widely-available cheeses are partially made from wood.

title: Israel Just Banned Heinz Ketchup
subtitle: Israel didn't ban the sale of Heinz brand ketchup; the country's Health Ministry just ruled that the company had to rebrand it as "tomato seasoning."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Israel has banned the sale of Heinz brand ketchup, partially due to the product's use of GMO-derived ingredients.

title: EPA Seeks to Ban Racecar Conversions?
subtitle: A February 2016 press release led many racing enthusiasts to believe the EPA had banned road car-to-racecar conversions.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is banning the conversion of road cars to racecars.

title: Texas Man Forced to Take Down U.S. Flag Because Muslims Were Offended?
subtitle: A false claim from 2014 about a Texas man forced to take down his American flag because it threatened Muslims has been resurrected.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Texas man was forced to take his American flag down because its display threatened Muslims.

title: Captain America Deemed Offensive?
subtitle: A woman claimed that her brother's Captain America costume was deemed "offensive" by school officials, but details of the incident conflicted with that claim.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A high student was forced to leave school because an assistant principal found his Captain America costume to be "offensive."

title: Does the Word 'Guacamole' Mean 'Testicle Sauce'?
subtitle: Both "avocado" and "guacamole" derive from the Nahuatl word for the fruit, which only secondarily carries the slang meaning of "testicle."
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The word "guacamole" literally translates as "testicle sauce."

title: Muslims Demand Prayer Room in Lancashire Craft Shop?
subtitle: A UK-based rumor held that four Muslim men nearly prompted a riot by demanding a rural craft center provide them with a prayer room, but the truth behind the claim was less sensational.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Four Muslim men prompted a riot by demanding that a small rural craft shop in England provide them with a prayer room.

title: Michigan Senate Passes Law Banning Sodomy?
subtitle: A bill passed by the Michigan senate to strengthen state animal cruelty laws left intact old, unenforceable language criminalizing sodomy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The state of Michigan has passed a law banning oral and anal sex.

title: Does McDonald's Food Not Rot?
subtitle: Photographs of an ancient McDonald's order went viral on Facebook, but the "phenomenon" of non-decomposing fast food isn't so straightforward.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photographs of a six-year-old Happy Meal document that McDonald's food items don't break down or rot like "real" food.

title: Colorado School District Forces Students to Follow Sharia Dress Code?
subtitle: A Colorado school's field trip to several houses of worship prompted controversy over a dress code requirement, largely due to slanted reporting.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Colorado school's female students were forced to adhere to "Sharia rules" when visiting a mosque on a field trip.

title: Germany Distributes Leaflets Discouraging Rape After Cologne Incident?
subtitle: Germany didn't create cartoon leaflets explaining sexual assault following a controversy in Cologne on New Year's Eve.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Germany created and distributed leaflets to curb sexual assault due to an incident in Cologne on New Year's Eve.

title: Do a Net Worth Over $1 Million Disqualify You from Military Service?
subtitle: A long-circulating rumor holds that individuals with a high net worth are ineligible to serve in the military due to a potential for insubordination.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Individuals with a high net worth are ineligible to serve in the military because they are more likely to be insubordinate.

title: FALSE: Trump Tweets Image of Bernie Sanders in Gas Chamber
subtitle: A social media game of telephone led to the mistaken belief Donald Trump tweeted an image of himself sending Bernie Sanders to a gas chamber.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump tweeted an image in which he was depicted placing Bernie Sanders into a gas chamber.

title: Obama Allows Satanic Ceremony at State Capitol
subtitle: A "Satanic ceremony" held by a group in Lansing in December 2015 was neither literally Satanic nor in any way sanctioned by President Obama.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama permitted the first-ever Satanic ceremony at a State Capitol.

title: Do 10 Percent of College Grads Think Judge Judy Is on the Supreme Court?
subtitle: Several web sites reported that 10 percent of college grads thought Judge Judy was a Supreme Court justice, but the claim was purposefully misleading.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ten percent of college grads surveyed indicated Judge Judy was a Supreme Court justice.

title: NYC Is Not Installing 'Public Masturbation' Booths
subtitle: A "public masturbation booth" in NYC was a publicity stunt for a sex toy company.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The city of New York is installing public masturbation booths.

title: Social Security Changes to Take Effect 1 May 2016
subtitle: Some changes are coming to Social Security on 1 May 2016, but they are not major ones that "threaten the financial security" of millions of Americans.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Changes coming to Social Security on 1 May 2016 "threaten the financial security" of millions of Americans.

title: Botched Medical Cannabis Trial in France?
subtitle: A severe adverse event occurred during a drug trial in France, but the drug did not contain or involve cannabis (marijuana).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A cannabis drug trial in France led to serious adverse effects in several subjects.

title: Eric Holder Participated in an Armed Takeover of an ROTC Office
subtitle: A 2012 article claiming former attorney general Eric Holder participated in an armed occupation of a university ROTC office has resurfaced, but the original report was inaccurate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Eric Holder participated in the armed occupation of a Columbia University ROTC office in 1970.

title: FALSE: One-Third of Doctors Won't Recommend Gardasil HPV Vaccine
subtitle: An article in the journal 'Pediatrics' was misconstrued to suggest that a third of physicians surveyed objected to the  Gardasil HPV vaccine.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A recent study revealed that one-third of pediatricians refuse to recommend the Gardasil HPV vaccine to patients.

title: Connecticut Begins Sending Gun Confiscation Letters
subtitle: Social media users rediscovered a March 2014 article claiming Connecticut residents received "gun confiscation letters" and mistook its claims as current or accurate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Connecticut gun owners have started receiving "gun confiscation letters."

title: Facebook Cold Stone Pregnancy Discount
subtitle: By and large, Cold Stone Creamery isn't giving away free or discounted ice cream to women who appear to be pregnant.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Cold Stone Creamery is giving free or discounted ice cream to female customers that appear to be pregnant.

title: McDonald's Getting Rid of the Dollar Menu?
subtitle: McDonald's isn't getting rid of its Dollar Menu, but a few elements are slated for adjustment.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: McDonald's is getting rid of its "Dollar Menu" come 2016.

title: Gas Station Shuns Serviceman?
subtitle: A Facebook user claimed that a Long Island gas station refused to sell his son tobacco chew because the store doesn't serve the military.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The gas station next to Higbie Bagels refused to sell tobacco to a serviceman who presented military ID, because the station's owners are anti-military.

title: Burger King Bows to Sharia Law?
subtitle: Misleading articles claimed Burger King "bowed to Sharia law" by banning bacon and urged Americans to boycott the chain despite the fact that the underlying story originated in France and didn't appear to involve actual Burger King stores.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Burger King has "bowed to Sharia law" and will no longer serve bacon at their restaurants.

title: PS 169 Pledge of Allegiance and Holiday Ban Controversy
subtitle: The social media outrage machine went into overdrive following claims a Brooklyn principal banned holidays and the Pledge of Allegiance.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: PS 169 Principal Eujin Jaela Kim banned the Pledge of Allegiance, Santa, and Thanksgiving.

title: Large Cell Phone Purchase Rumor
subtitle: Social media rumors claim several suspicious purchases of 60 cell phones were made by Middle Eastern men at Walmarts in or around Lebanon, Missouri.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Middle Eastern men purchased dozens of burner cell phones at Walmarts in and around Lebanon, Missouri (ostensibly to carry out terror attacks); at the same time, multiple stores reported propane tank thefts.

title: Did Donald Trump's Grandfather Make His Fortune in Prostitution?
subtitle: A meme claimed Frederick Trump was a pimp and drug dealer who made his fortune running a brothel and opium den.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's grandfather Frederick Trump was a pimp and drug dealer who made his fortune running a brothel and opium den.

title: Are Fruit Stickers Edible?
subtitle: Should you eat the stickers on fruit? Are they made from special "edible paper"?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Price-Look Up (PLU) code stickers on vegetables and fruit are edible.

title: Can You Identify Chinese-Grown Garlic from Its Lack of Roots?
subtitle: Some people claim garlic imported from China is identifiable by a lack of root material, but that's not always a reliable way to determine the product's origins.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can easily identify garlic imported from China due to its lack of visible roots.

title: Mandatory Gun Ownership in Kennesaw, Georgia
subtitle: Did a mandatory gun ownership law in Kennesaw, Georgia, cause the town's crime rate to plummet?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A mandatory gun ownership law in Kennesaw, Georgia, caused the town's crime rate to plummet.

title: Does the U.S. Have the Third-Highest Rate of Homicides Worldwide?
subtitle: A meme asserts that the U.S. has the third-highest rate of homicides worldwide but drops dramatically in the rankings if four major cities are excluded from the stats.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The United States has the third-highest rate of homicides worldwide, but drops dramatically in the rankings if four major cities are excluded from the stats.

title: Was 'Duck Dynasty' Star Sadie Robertson Seriously Injured in a Car Accident?
subtitle: Duck Lie-nasty.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Duck Dynasty

title: After Birth Abortion
subtitle: Are American liberals debating the merits of "after birth abortion"?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: American liberals are debating the merits of "after birth abortion."

title: President Obama Changes Oath of Allegiance
subtitle: President Obama has not removed a vow to defend the U.S. from the Oath of Allegiance sworn by all newly naturalized citizens.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama has changed the Oath of Allegiance for naturalized citizens to remove a vow to defend the U.S.

title: How Are Baby Carrots Made?
subtitle: Baby carrots are just small carrots or carrot chunks, not 'deformed full-sized carrots that have been soaked in chlorine.'
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Baby carrots are made from deformed full-sized carrots that have been soaked in chlorine.

title: Dangerous Lead in Lipstick?
subtitle: Do several major brands of lipstick contain dangerous levels of lead that can be detected with a gold ring?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Several major brands of lipstick contain dangerous levels of cancer-causing lead which can be detected with a gold ring.

title: Do Lemon Fresh Joy and Listerine Kill Mosquitoes?
subtitle: Lemon Fresh Joy, Listerine, and limes with cloves are all claimed as effective countermeasures for driving off mosquitoes.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Lemon Fresh Joy (a dishwashing liquid), Listerine (a mouthwash), and limes with cloves will repeal mosquitoes or knock them dead from the sky.

title: Does Your Food Contain Beaver Secretions?
subtitle: Alarmist warnings about beaver-derived castoreum are overblown: its use is now exceedingly rare, and the typical consumer is unlikely to ever encounter castoreum in food.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Castoreum, a secretion produced by beavers, is commonly used as a food additive.

title: Rumors About Target
subtitle: We fact check a number of claims about Target's relationship with veterans' causes, ownership, and purported political stances.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Various rumors about the Target chain of retail stores (see below).

title: Did an Oregon Man Get a Prison Sentence for Collecting Rainwater on His Own Property?
subtitle: Gary Harrington was sentenced followed several years of legal dispute over what the state continually described his willful and flagrant operation of a number of illegal reservoirs.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An Oregon man was jailed for collecting rainwater on his own property.

title: Does Locks of Love Sell Donated Hair?
subtitle: Claims that Locks of Love sells most donated hair for profit and charges ailing children exorbitant amounts of money for wigs are based on a misunderstanding of the charity's procedures and functions.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Locks of Love sells most donated hair for profit and charges ailing children exorbitant amounts for wigs.

title: Worldwide Chocolate Shortage?
subtitle: Rumor: The world will run out of chocolate by 2020.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The world will run out of chocolate by the year 2020.

title: Chris Kyle and 'American Sniper'
subtitle: 'American Sniper' Chris Kyle did not shoot dozens of Hurricane Katrina looters, kill two attempted carjackers, and punch Jesse Ventura in the face.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: American Sniper

title: Was the U.S. Government Found Guilty of Assassinating Martin Luther King, Jr.?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists hold that the United States government was sued and found culpable for the murder of the civil rights icon, but the news media refused to report it.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. government was sued and found culpable for the murder of Martin Luther King, Jr., but the news media refused to report it.

title: Texas to Permit Medicinal and Recreational Marijuana Use
subtitle: Texas has legalized the use of marijuana for treating a form of epilepsy, but not for other medicinal or recreational uses.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Texas is about to legalize marijuana for medicinal and recreational use.

title: Facebook Listens?
subtitle: The Facebook 'Identify TV and Music' app uses your phone's microphone to listen, but it doesn't record your personal conversations.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Facebook 'Identify TV and Music' app spies on users by listening to and recording sounds through their phones, and uses ambient conversation to tailor advertising.

title: Does the Red Cross Charge Disaster Victims They Assist?
subtitle: False rumors that the American Red Cross collects fees from those whom they assist have dogged the relief organization since World War I.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The American Red Cross charges a fee to persons whom they assist.

title: Are Facebook Pirates 'Cloning' Accounts?
subtitle: Warning alerts social media users that Facebook 'pirates' Facebook "pirates" perpetrate scams by setting up look-alike Facebook accounts that copy other users' profiles.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Facebook "pirates" perpetrate scams by setting up look-alike Facebook accounts that copy other users' profiles.

title: Dallas Uninsured Motorist Crackdown
subtitle: Viral message claims the traffic accident rate in Dallas declined sharply after police began impounding uninsured vehicles largely owned by undocumented persons.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Super Bowl Prostitution Increase
subtitle: Rumor: Every year legions of prostitutes flock to the city where the Super Bowl is being held.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Did the Department of Energy Spend $737 Million to Benefit Ronald Pelosi?
subtitle: Seven lines of copy-and-paste text involving Rep. Nancy Pelosi's brother-in-law and a solar energy project have been shared on social media since 2011.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Department of Energy spent $737 million on SolarReserve to create 45 jobs and benefit Ron Pelosi.

title: Muslim Demographics
subtitle: Statistics demonstrate that 'Islam will overwhelm Christendom unless Christians recognize the demographic realities and begin reproducing again'?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Statistics demonstrate that "Islam will overwhelm Christendom unless Christians recognize the demographic realities and begin reproducing again."

title: Must the President and Vice-President Be from Different States?
subtitle: Many people believe the U.S. constitution requires that presidential and vice-presidential candidates be from different states. Is that really the case?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.S. president and vice-president are constitutionally required to be from different states.

title: Was 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre' Based on a True Story?
subtitle: A remake of 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre' was promoted with the tagline, "Inspired by a true story," prompting fans to wonder about the origin of this horror classic.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The film

title: Are Green Potatoes Poisonous?
subtitle: Green potatoes do contain a form of toxin, but you are unlikely to ingest enough of it to do you any harm.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: You should avoid eating green potatoes because they are poisonous.

title: Did U.S. Senators Vote to “Give 'Illegal Aliens' Social Security Benefits”?
subtitle: In 2006, a roll call vote was paired with a mischaracterization of the amendment in question.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An article listed senators who "voted to give 'illegal aliens' Social Security benefits."

title: Did Steven Spielberg Get His Start by Sneaking Into an Empty Universal Studios Office?
subtitle: As comedian George Burns once declared, "Most of what I say is true. The rest is show business."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Famed director Steven Spielberg got his start by sneaking into Universal Studios and commandeering an unoccupied office.
